title: Never mind the calendar. Summer is over for students as the new school year begins
description: The new school year is here for students in and around Fort Collins, with most returning to classes Aug. 13-14 and the rest soon after.
content:
Not officially, of course, with the vernal equinox still more than a month away.

But for students in kindergarten through 12th grade in and around Fort Collins, fall starts Aug. 13-14.

The first day of school for the 2025-26 school year for all sixth and ninth graders in Poudre, Thompson and Weld RE-4 school districts is Aug. 13, allowing those students new to middle and high schools to get the lay of the land before they’re joined by the returning students. In the Thompson and Weld RE-4 school districts, kindergarten students also start Aug. 13.

All students in Poudre, Thompson and Weld RE-4’s non-charter schools return to class Aug. 14. School start and dismissal times vary by school.

Starting dates for local charter schools and private schools in the area vary, with some already in session for the 2025-26 school year and others beginning Aug. 25.

Here's a list, based on information obtained from district and school spokespeople and websites:
• None Colorado Early Colleges-Fort Collins: Aug. 8 (sixth and ninth graders and new students start Aug. 7)

Reporter Kelly Lyell covers education, breaking news, some sports and other topics of interest for the Coloradoan. Contact him at kellylyell@coloradoan.com, x.com/KellyLyell, threads.net/KellyLyell and facebook.com/KellyLyell.news.

scraped_sources.text:
Never mind the calendar. Summer is over for students as the new school year begins
- The 2025-26 school year for most K-12 students in the Fort Collins area begins August 13-14.
- Sixth and ninth graders, and in some districts kindergarteners, will have a transition day on August 13.
- Local community colleges and universities begin classes later in August.
Summer’s over.
Not officially, of course, with the vernal equinox still more than a month away.
But for students in kindergarten through 12th grade in and around Fort Collins, fall starts Aug. 13-14.
The first day of school for the 2025-26 school year for all sixth and ninth graders in Poudre, Thompson and Weld RE-4 school districts is Aug. 13, allowing those students new to middle and high schools to get the lay of the land before they’re joined by the returning students. In the Thompson and Weld RE-4 school districts, kindergarten students also start Aug. 13.
All students in Poudre, Thompson and Weld RE-4’s non-charter schools return to class Aug. 14. School start and dismissal times vary by school.
Starting dates for local charter schools and private schools in the area vary, with some already in session for the 2025-26 school year and others beginning Aug. 25.
Here's a list, based on information obtained from district and school spokespeople and websites:
K-12 public school districts
- Poudre School District: Aug. 14 (sixth and ninth graders begin Aug. 13 with transition day)
- Thompson School District: Aug. 14 (kindergarteners, sixth and ninth graders begin Aug. 13 with transition day)
- Weld RE-4 (Windsor-Severance) School District: Aug. 14 (kindergarteners, sixth and ninth graders begin Aug. 13 with transition day)
Other K-12 schools
- American Legacy Academy: Aug. 20 (half-day kindergarteners start Aug. 19)
- Ascent Classical Academy of Northern Colorado: Aug. 25
- AXIS International Academy: Aug. 13 (kindergartners start Aug. 12)
- Colorado Early Colleges-Fort Collins: Aug. 8 (sixth and ninth graders and new students start Aug. 7)
- Colorado Early Colleges-Windsor: Aug. 11 (sixth graders and new students start Aug. 8)
- Compass Community Collaborative School: Aug. 14 (new students start Aug. 13)
- Fort Collins Montessori School: Aug. 14
- Heritage Christian Academy: Aug. 18
- Liberty Common: Aug. 25
- Loveland Classical Schools: Aug. 26
- Mountain Sage Community School: Aug. 13 (kindergartners start Aug. 14)
- New Vision Charter School: Aug. 14
- Resurrection Christian School: Aug. 25
- Ridgeview Classical Schools: Aug. 19 for kindergartners and high school, Aug. 20 grades 1-8
- St. Joseph Catholic School: Aug. 25
- Windsor Charter Academy: Aug. 14 (kindergartners, sixth and ninth graders start Aug. 13)
Community colleges
- Aims Community College: Aug. 25
- Front Range Community College: Aug. 18
Universities
- Colorado State University: Aug. 25
- University of Colorado-Boulder: Aug. 21
- University of Northern Colorado: Aug. 25

Various local charter and private schools have different start dates, with some beginning as early as August 8.
